title: الإِعْلَال وَالإِبْدَال
description: Learn about الإعلال (changes to weak letters و، ي، ا) and الإبدال (letter substitution), the systematic morphological transformation rules in Arabic.

notes.title: What is الإعلال?
content: الإعلال is the change that occurs to weak letters (حروف العلة: و، ي، ا) in words. These changes happen to make pronunciation easier.
There are three main types: القلب (converting one letter to another), الحذف (deleting a letter), and الإسكان (making a letter silent).

notes.title: Types of الإعلال
content: القلب (conversion): When و or ي with a fatha before it becomes ا (alif). قَوَلَ → قَالَ because و has fatha and the letter before it (ق) has fatha.
الحذف (deletion): When a weak letter is deleted for ease. In يَقُولُ, the original يَقْوُلُ had the ع deleted because و was ساكن after ضمة.
keyPoints: Rule: و or ي with fatha after fatha → ا
قَوَلَ → قَالَ، بَيَعَ → بَاعَ، خَوِفَ → خَافَ
Rule: When conjugating, weak middle letter changes
قُلْتُ (I said) - the و deleted: قَوَلْتُ → قُلْتُ

notes.title: What is الإبدال?
content: الإبدال is replacing one letter with another for phonetic ease. It's broader than الإعلال and can involve any letters, not just weak ones.
Common patterns include: ت of افتعل becoming د or ط, همزة becoming و or ي, and تاء التفعّل becoming other letters.
keyPoints: Replacing one letter with another entirely

notes.title: Common Patterns of Change
content: Understanding these patterns helps predict word forms. Hollow verbs (أجوف) like قال، باع، نام follow predictable patterns when conjugated.
In the past tense with ت endings: قَالَ → قُلْتَ، قُلْنَا. In the jussive: يَقُولُ → لَمْ يَقُلْ.
keyPoints: Hollow verbs: middle radical is weak (قال، نام، زار)
Past + pronoun suffix: قَالَ → قُلْتُ (و deleted, فاء takes ضمة)
Jussive mood: يَقُولُ → لَمْ يَقُلْ (و deleted)
Defective verbs: final radical weak (دَعَا، رَمَى)

examples.english: He said, I said, we said, they said

examples.arabic: لَمْ يَقُلْ، لَمْ يَبِعْ، لَمْ يَنَمْ

examples.english: He called, I called, he calls, call!
He threw, I threw, he throws, throw!
